title: How to find Twitter datasets for download - Quora

response.answer_text: Luckily, I personally using a tool to download twitter datasets. Its name Trackmyhashtag. It helps to gain access to Twitter Datasets for any time period or search term as per your requirements. It is an advanced twitter tracking tool which can fetch datasets of any hashtag, mention, keyword or account. The pricing is also affordable. Features of Trackmyhashtag :- Helps to download real-time and historical twitter datasetsHelps to download geographical location based Twitter dataHelps to download language based data setTwitter datasets in Excel or CSV fileDetailed analysis report with lots of insightful metricsVisit : Twitter Dataset Download - TrackMyHashtags You can see metrics report and meta data yourself. or you can Simply visit Trackmyhashtag website and ask them for any kind of twitter datasets for any time period or for other requirements on their live support chat. Thank you :)

you can check the Links below and use the data sets 476 million Twitter tweets Cheng-Caverlee-Lee September 2009 - January 2010 Twitter Scrape : Free Download & Streaming : Internet Archive Social Computing Data Repository at ASU Interesting Social Media Datasets Datasets Archive - Followthehashtag // Free twitter search analytics and business intelligence tool https://www.reddit.com/r/datasets/comments/1yc31e/two_researchers_in_search_of_twitter_datasets/

I was having same question when I encountered this thread a month ago. There are many tools (free and paid) although nothing was enough so I made my own tool that uses web mining and some other APIs. Finally I have made that tool online. http://www.orgneat.com It uses some existing database I have plus data from twitter public threads and gives you result in CSV. I am also working on NLP (Sentiment, Classification, Topic etc) and will add to it. There are many answers to this question, though appreciate few, others are just to promote their tool here. The tool I made completely runs on my own computer and is free for any academic/research work.

Check out Open Data Network. I've linked it to query for twitter, and there's quite a bit of data here that you can play around with. Most of it is governmental. It also has a whole host of other data that's completely open to use. The best part is (in my opinion), is that you can access the data via APIs. That's awesome.

Contact Followersanalysis[dot]com and ask for any kind of data you want. They provide following data: Complete Twitter archive of a Twitter userComplete followers list of any Twitter userComplete following list of any Twitter userHistorical Tweets of keyword/hashtag.You can also contact them at their live chat support of their website.

You can quickly purchase data from DataSift http://datasift.com - you can use a pre-built stream http://datasift.com/solutions/prebuiltstreams or using our CSDL language http://dev.datasift.com/csdl define your own dataset.  It would be quickly possible to consume via one of our libraries any volume of data for you to play with.

There is a big data challenge organized by Telecom Italia in 2014. I know they released twitter data about two Italian cities there : Milan and Trento.  In this post among many other categories of data you find the link to the challenge dataset.  Alket Cecaj's post in Algorithms & Data Fusion
For the purpose of academic research on social network, there is a link providing twitter social graph.What is Twitter, a Social Network or a News Media? on Data section.

You can use DiscoverText to collect day-forward using the Twitter Search API or the Gnip PowerTrack for Twitter. You can use Sifter to get free estimates of the cost to get access to any set of undeleted Tweets in history.

Under your account settings: https://twitter.com/settings/account, scroll all the way to the bottom and you'll see this:   It takes a little while, but they'll email you a file containing all of your tweets in a few days.

Using their api. Twitter provides rich set of api and solid SLA in response. It comes handy for both real time as well a batch processing. Recommend to read their documentation for deep dive. Twitter Developers All the best.
